title: Ticket #446: collector is freezing up after a forked child exits
description:
Soon after merging in the thread code (#17), some regression tests would occasionally fail.

DanB reported the following via email: 

Looking in all of the other failed test logs from last night, I see the
same pattern.  The collector is freezing up after a forked child exits
and the collector has not yet processed the SIGCHLD.

Here's one:
04/30 02:15:48 (fd:6) (pid:15426) ForkWork: Child 15426 done, status 0
04/30 02:15:48 (fd:5) (pid:15294) Entering thread safe start [select] in
selector.cpp:311 unknown()

And another:
04/30 09:00:36 (fd:6) (pid:22825) ForkWork: Child 22825 done, status 0
04/30 09:00:36 (fd:5) (pid:22806) Entering thread safe stop [select] in
selector.cpp:317 unknown()
04/30 09:00:36 (fd:5) (pid:22806) Leaving thread safe stop [select] in
selector.cpp:317 unknown()
remarks:
2009-Apr-30 18:29:00 by tannenba:
Looks like the problem is with the mutex in dprintf, which was added to make dprintf() thread safe to aid in thread-related debugging.

The issue is in dprintf, we grab the mutex before blocking signals that could generate dprintfs (like SIGCHLD). So if the SIGCHLD signal is delivered in the small window between grabbing the mutex and blocking dprintf-generating signals, we deadlock.

Will commit simple patch to master branch to grab mutex after signals are blocked, and of course release the mutex before signals are released.
